Question: This person noted that occasionally such experiences had been known to reform alcoholics where all else had failed.
Hints: Of particular value to this person was a visit with Chief Mountain Lake of the Taos Pueblo near Taos, New Mexico.
This person gave a talk on psychological types, the introverted and the extraverted type in analytical psychology.
This person saw the human psyche as "by nature religious", and made this religiousness the focus of his explorations.
